title: Hiring manager rejects job candidate after failing to schedule an interview for over a month, candidate responds to the rejection email: ‘Good luck or whatever’
description: Have you ever wondered what your conversations would sound like if you were completely honest with the person standing in front of you? Or even how the world would look like if people truly spoke up and said what is on their minds?There are several funny skits online, and even an iconic movie about a world in which people cannot lie, and always tell the truth to each other. All to show just how easy, and slightly chaotic, the world could look like if we were all just a little bit more honest and open.However realistically, we do not live in a world where people simply say whatever they want. There are etiquettes and social rules in place, that are here to ensure we do not embarrass ourselves and others when we engage in conversation. Whether we're talking to colleagues, friends, family, or even hiring managers, there are some things you should keep to yourselves, even if it sounds extremely freeing to let it all go and speak your mind.
author: Bar Mor Hazut

html:
When it comes to job searching, you usually want to be on your best behavior. Whether you end up getting a job or not, you should always be respectful to the person in front of you, because you never know when your paths might cross again.

It seems like the job candidate in the story below did not care one bit about what the hiring manager would think of them, because as soon they were rejected from the job, they decided to respond with the most unhinge email we have ever read.

Keep scrolling to read the full story, written from the perspective of the hiring manager.
